learningPlan.title: Learning Plan
learningPlan.shortdesc: Learning plan for a hands-on lesson focused on next steps with ontologies and semantic data modeling.

keywords.indexterm: Gabriel García Márquez One Hundred Years of Solitude

lcPlanTitle.p: Lesson 5: Next Steps with Semantic Data Modeling and Ontology Development

lcPlanSubject.title: Focus
lcPlanSubject.p: This lesson will focus on sketching out what an ontology for library information resources might look like if done from scratch.

lcPlanDescrip.title: Overview
lcPlanDescrip.p: In this lesson, participants will use the competency questions drafted in the previous lesson as a terminology source for representing concepts in a domain ontology for library information resources. They will work on a card-sorting activity using MARC 21 data to build out their model.

lcPlanPrereqs.title: Prerequisites
lcPlanPrereqs.p: As preparation for this lesson, participants will have developed a set of competency questions to guide them as they identify the key entities, relationships, and attributes that will be modeled. They will understand what an ontology is and how ontologies fit into the broader linked data ecosystem.

lcInterventionItem.lcLearnStrat: Provide scaffolding for the card-sorting activity. Explain the source of the data (MARC 21 Bibliographic record for a Library of Congress copy of One Hundred Years of Solitude and MARC 21 Authority record for Gabriel García Márquez). Explain the information on the labeled versions of the activity cards.
lcInterventionItem.lcPlanObjective: The goal of instruction is to ensure that learners understand the purpose of the activity and are prepared for any challenges that may arise.
lcInterventionItem.lcAssessment: Check for comprehension before starting the activity.

lcInterventionItem.lcLearnStrat: During the card-sorting activity, participants will use inductive reasoning to classify discrete units of descriptive metadata and reflect on the limitations of current approaches.
lcInterventionItem.lcPlanObjective: Existing metadata will be used as a basis for participants to practice domain modeling and understand the Library of Congress BIBFRAME and MADS/RDF ontologies.
lcInterventionItem.lcAssessment: The activity will be assessed through group discussion and reflection.
lcInterventionItem.lcDelivery: Participants will work in groups of four to five people. They will be given three sets of cards with data elements printed on them and asked to sort the cards into meaningful groups.
